note.p: Death: The Grove, near Sevenoaks, Kent (04 June 1856)

Career: Apprenticed to a surgeon in Edinburgh; lived in the house of Meckel, the anatomist, whilst studying in Halle; Physician, Westminster Hospital (1794); Physician to the Duke of Cambridge; Physician to Tzar Alexander I of Russia (1804); returned to England (1819)
Memberships: Corporation of Surgeons, but was disenfranchised
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1856-1857 vol 8 pp 269-272
References: John H Appleby, 'Sir Alexander Crichton, FRS (1763-1856), Imperial Russian Physician at Large' in NR 1999 vol 53 pp 219-230, plate
E M Tansey, 'The Life and Works of Sir Alexander Crichton, FRS (1763-1856): A Scottish Physician to the Imperial Russian Court' in NR 1983-84 vol 38 pp 241-259
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
